question: The "Vyborg-Petrozavodsk Offensive" was a strategic military operation initiated against which country?
explanation: The Vyborg-Petrozavodsk Offensive, also known as Karelian Offensive, was a strategic military operation initiated by the Soviet Leningrad and Karelian Fronts against Finland as part of the Continuation War during the Eastern Front of World War II on the Karelian Isthmus and East Karelian fronts from 10 June 1944 to 9 August 1944. This offensive resulted initially in the Soviet tactical victory but ended in a military stalemate through the signing of the Moscow Armistice and Finland was forced to give concessions.
